channel.description: Recent content in blogs on Janani Ravi

item.title: 2018: Year in Review | RLEL
item.description: Thanks to everyone who attended, participated or sponsored R-Ladies East Lansing in 2018! We had a fantastic start & a very successful first 6mo on campus! We hosted 7 meetups since July 2018 including two very well-attended workshops (70+ attendees) and a DataViz challenge! Help us continue spreading the R & Data Science spirit across MSU in 2019! Contact us eastlansing@rladies.org about co-hosting or sponsoring a meetup/workshop in Spring 2019.

item.title: Useful Resources
item.description: My posts with some #useful-resources. Great posts | academic The Awesomest 7-year Postdoc by Radhika Nagpal | Scientific American Matt Might’s Blog Modeler’s Hippocratic oath Bioinformatics Microbial Bioinformatics Starter Kit by Lauren Cowley Microbial genome annotation by Michael Eisen Twitter thread & moment Tools for bacterial comparative genomes by Holt lab R Git, GitHub and R R resources by Paul Vanderlaken Related post: R Tips and Tricks Data Visualization Plotting trees + data by Holt Lab Blogdown, Hugo, Academic & R Markdown Blogdown: Creating websites with R Markdown by Yihui Xie Hugo Hugo discussion forum Hugo Academic by George Cushen Academic R Markdown Building your blog using blogdown by Marie Dussault Blogging tips Lifehacker 6 tips for low-cost academic blogging by Matt Might Ready to start your data science blog?

item.title: Modeler's Hippocratic Oath
item.description: I recently came across the Modeler’s Hippocratic Oath while reading Cathy O’Neil’s ‘Weapons of Math Destruction’. This was originally written by Emanuel Derman and Paul Wilmott in the wake of the 2008 financial crisis. The Oath I will remember that I didn’t make the world, and it doesn’t satisfy my equations. Though I will use models boldly to estimate value, I will not be overly impressed by mathematics. I will never sacrifice reality for elegance without explaining why I have done so.

item.title: Matt Might's Blog
item.description: Background Matt Might has an awesome easy-to-read blog that has inspired us in many ways! Matt is a tenured CS professor at Utah and a visiting professor at HMS (Harvard Medical School). He’s the dad of 3 kids, one of whom has a very rare genetic disorder. He & his wife have spent a good part of their lives educating themselves and others about the disease. Some of his useful blog posts Health | Strength-training | JustDoIt HOWTO: Gain strength and muscle Least resistance weight loss Path of least resistance Handling repetitive strain injury (e.
